page.title: 12Popolar Farm Worlingworth
page.content: Q1What is a typical year on your farm? A1Pig feeding.The arable year starts with ploughing & drilling after harvest Next beet harvesting,manuring & cultiv- ating.Spring involves beet planting, spraying winter cereals,sowing spring barley & spraying rape.Harvest brings combining,baling & stubble burning. Q2Tell me about when you began farming? A2 3 horses were used for general work & a tractor for ploughing.Manuring, ditching & gleaning done manually. A binder was used for harvesting.Stacks were thatched. Q3How do you see future farming? A3There must be changes in the types of sprays & fertilizers being used to avoid environmental damage.Legislation on the lines now applied to milk will be needed to avoid over production of cereals.
